    # Check if the input is a string
    if type(word) != str:
        return False
    
    # Check if the input is not empty

        return False
    
    # Convert the word to lowercase
    word = word.lower()
    
    # Remove non-letter characters
    word = re.sub("[^a-z]", "", word)
    
    # Count the number of occurrences of each letter in the word
    letter_counts = Counter(word)
    
    # Check if all letter counts are the same
    if len(set(letter_counts.values())) == 1:
        return True
    else:
        return False

def is_isogram(word):

def is_isogram(word):
    if not isinstance(word, str):   # Check if word is a string
        return False
    if len(word) == 0:   # Check if word is empty
        return False
    
    word = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', word)   # Remove non-letter characters
    word = word.lower()   # Convert all letters to lowercase
    count = Counter(word)   # Count the number of occurrences of each letter

    if len(count) == 1:   # If there is only one letter, it is an isogram
        return True

    # Check if each letter appears the same number of times
    return len(set(count.values())) == 1
